name: A.P. (DIR Series) Circular No. 19
summary: This circular expands the investment basket for Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPI) in corporate debt securities. It allows FPIs to invest in unlisted corporate debt securities with minimum 3-year maturity and securitised debt instruments, subject to certain conditions. The total investment limit in unlisted corporate debt securities and securitised debt instruments is set at ₹35,000 crore within the overall corporate bond limit of ₹2,44,323 crore. The circular also specifies restrictions on investments in real estate business, capital market, and land purchase.
questions: What is the investment limit for FPIs in unlisted corporate debt securities and securitised debt instruments?
What is the minimum residual maturity requirement for unlisted corporate debt securities?
Are securitised debt instruments subject to the minimum 3-year residual maturity requirement?
Under which sections of the Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999 have the directions in this circular been issued?
When will the revised norms be reviewed?
